subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Friday, April 20, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

GOP: Reid has turned his back on troops

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid
said Thursday the war in Iraq is "lost," triggering an angry
backlash by Republicans, who said the top Democrat had turned
his back on the troops.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/04/20/reid.iraq.ap/index.html

***

Gates 'respectfully'
disagrees with Reid that 'war is lost'

BAGHDAD (CNN) -- Defense Secretary Robert Gates, in Iraq to
meet with commanders and assess the progress of the Baghdad
security crackdown, said Friday he disagrees with the Senate
majority leader's declaration that the war in Iraq has been
"lost."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/gates-respectfully-disagrees-with-reid.html

***

Vermont Senate adopts resolution seeking
president's impeachment

MONTPELIER, Vermont
(AP) -- Vermont senators voted Friday to call for the
impeachment of President Bush and Vice President Dick Cheney,
saying their actions have raised "serious questions of
constitutionality."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/vermont-senate-adopts-resolution.html

***

GOP senator says Gonzales should consider
resigning

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Jeff
Sessions, R-Alabama, told CNN Friday that Attorney Gen. Alberto
Gonzales ought to consider the possibility of resigning his
post.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/gop-senator-says-gonzales-should.html

***

Administration officials: Gonzales may be convinced
to step down

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- After
Thursday's Senate Judiciary Committee hearing, several
administration officials tell CNN they believe the attorney
general should and may be convinced to step down.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/administration-officials-gonzales-may.html

***

No. 3 House Republican disappointed with
Gonzales' testimony, says need for fresh leadership

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The No. 3 House Republican told
CNN Friday he wasn't impressed with Attorney Gen. Alberto
Gonzales' testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee and
suggested Gonzales should resign his post.

Full
story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/no-3-house-republican-disappointed-with.html

***

Richardson says it's time for Gonzales to step
down

DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- New Mexico Gov.
Bill Richardson became the latest Democratic presidential
candidate Friday to call for Attorney General Alberto Gonzales
to resign, saying he's become a burden to the Justice
Department.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/richardson-says-its-time-for-gonzales.html

***

MoveOn to air ad on McCain's 'Bomb Iran'
joke

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The liberal
political organization MoveOn.org announced Friday they will
air an ad in Iowa and New Hampshire that draws attention to
Sen. John McCain's recent "Bomb Iran" parody, a day after the
Arizona Republican said people who are criticizing his comments
need to "get a life."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/moveon-to-air-ad-on-mccains-bomb-iran.html

***

McCain to critics: 'Lighten up'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- After getting flak for recently singing
a "Bomb Iran" parody, Sen. John McCain, R-Arizona, told his
critics at a Las Vegas fundraiser Thursday night to "lighten up
and get a life."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-to-critics-lighten-up.html

***

Huckabee defends gun rights stance

LITTLE ROCK (AP) -- Republican presidential candidate Mike
Huckabee said a concealed handgun carried by a faculty member
or student at Virginia Tech might have reduced the toll from
Monday's shooting spree by a student.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/hucakbee-defends-gun-rights-stance.html

***

Abortion politics

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- The Supreme Court's 5-4 ruling banning a specific
abortion procedure Wednesday is giving hope to the pro-life
movement and causing concern among abortion rights activists,
CNN's Candy Crowley reports.

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/abortion-politics.html

***

Clinton's
campaign goes 'carbon neutral' for Earth Day

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Hillary Clinton's presidential
campaign said it is marking Earth Day this Sunday by going
"carbon neutral."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/clintons-campaign-goes-carbon-neutral.html
